```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(ggridges)


# Load the data
hospitals <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/36-SURE/36-SURE.github.io/main/data/hospitals.csv")

hospitals <- hospitals |>  clean_names()


```


```{r}
# Select relevant columns and remove rows with missing values
cost_data <- hospitals |> 
  select(facility_name, procedure_heart_attack_cost, procedure_heart_failure_cost, procedure_pneumonia_cost, procedure_hip_knee_cost) |> 
  drop_na()

cost_data <- cost_data |> 
  filter(procedure_heart_attack_cost != 0,
         procedure_heart_failure_cost != 0,
         procedure_pneumonia_cost != 0,
         procedure_hip_knee_cost != 0)

# Standardize the data
cost_data_scaled <- cost_data |> 
  select(-facility_name) |> 
  scale()

# Apply K-Means Clustering
set.seed(123)
kmeans_result <- kmeans(cost_data_scaled, centers = 3)

# Add cluster labels to the data
cost_data$Cluster <- kmeans_result$cluster


```


```{r}
# Updated Visualization with Custom Colors and Theme
cost_data |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = procedure_heart_attack_cost, y = procedure_heart_failure_cost, color = as.factor(Cluster))) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "K-Means Clustering on Procedure Costs", 
       subtitle = "Data from CORGIS Dataset Project",
       x = "Heart Attack Cost", 
       y = "Heart Failure Cost", 
       color = "Cluster") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("1" = "skyblue", "2" = "pink", "3" = "lightgreen")) +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "serif"),
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5),
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 8, face = "italic"),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 14)
  )


```

```{r}
# Select relevant columns and remove rows with missing values
cost_data <- hospitals %>%
  select(facility_name, procedure_heart_failure_cost, rating_overall, rating_mortality, rating_safety, rating_readmission, rating_experience) %>%
  drop_na()

# Filter out rows where any of the costs are zero and ratings are invalid
cost_data <- cost_data %>%
  filter(procedure_heart_failure_cost != 0, rating_overall > 0)

# Convert categorical ratings to numerical values
cost_data <- cost_data %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("rating_"), ~ case_when(
    . == "Above" ~ 1,
    . == "Same" ~ 2,
    . == "Below" ~ 3,
    . == "Unknown" ~ NA_real_,
    TRUE ~ as.numeric(.)
  )))

# Remove rows with NA values in the rating columns after conversion
cost_data <- cost_data %>% drop_na()

# Standardize the data (only numeric columns)
cost_data_scaled <- cost_data %>%
  select(procedure_heart_failure_cost, rating_overall, rating_mortality, rating_safety, rating_readmission, rating_experience) %>%
  scale()

# Apply K-Means Clustering
set.seed(123)
kmeans_result <- kmeans(cost_data_scaled, centers = 3)

# Add cluster labels to the data
cost_data$Cluster <- as.factor(kmeans_result$cluster)



```


```{r}
# Density ridges plot to visualize clusters
cost_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = procedure_heart_failure_cost, y = Cluster, fill = Cluster)) +
  geom_density_ridges(scale = 1) +
  labs(title = "K-Means Clustering on Heart Failure Cost",
       subtitle = "Data from CORGIS Dataset Project",
       x = "Heart Failure Cost",
       y = "Cluster") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("1" = "skyblue", "2" = "pink", "3" = "lightgreen")) +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "serif"),
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5),
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 8, face = "italic"),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 14)
  ) 




```
